revised_title: Comparative Study of the Appendicular Skeleton in Primates
tldr: The author examines the appendicular skeletons of various primates, including humans, to understand the anatomical resemblances and differences between them. They analyze the bones, dimensions, and proportions of the pectoral limbs and compare them to the spine. The study provides insights into the evolutionary relationships and classification of primates based on their skeletal structures.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
